if min or max are NA then the slider widget will be hidden

optionalSliderInput.Rd

Hidden input widgets are useful to have the input[[inputId]] variable on available in the server function but no corresponding visual clutter from input widgets that provide only a single choice.

optionalSliderInput(inputId, label, min, max, value, label_help = NULL, ...)

Arguments

inputId

The input slot that will be used to access the value.

label

Display label for the control, or NULL for no label.

min

The minimum and maximum values (inclusive) that can be selected.

max

The minimum and maximum values (inclusive) that can be selected.

value

The initial value of the slider, either a number, a date (class Date), or a date-time (class POSIXt). A length one vector will create a regular slider; a length two vector will create a double-ended range slider. Must lie between min and max.

label_help

optional an object of class shiny.tag. E.g. an object returned by helpText

...

optional arguments to sliderInput

Examples

optionalSliderInput("a", "b", 0, 1, 0.2)
#> <div class="form-group shiny-input-container">
#>   <label class="control-label" id="a-label" for="a">b</label>
#>   <input class="js-range-slider" id="a" data-skin="shiny" data-min="0" data-max="1" data-from="0.2" data-step="0.01" data-grid="true" data-grid-num="10" data-grid-snap="false" data-prettify-separator="," data-prettify-enabled="true" data-keyboard="true" data-data-type="number"/>
#> </div>
